image.altText: Composite image of Daniel Andrews and Kereyn Smith.

items.synopsis: Commonwealth Games Federation vice-president Kereyn Smith questions Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews's integrity over his decision to axe the 2026 Games.

title.children: 'Unprecedented': Games VP challenges Daniel Andrews's version of events on cancellation

image.altText: An elderly woman in a church

items.synopsis: NSW Police allege in court documents Senior Constable Kristian White's decision to deploy his taser on the elderly woman "does not meet the threshold" of acceptable use for officers.

title.children: Officer said 'na bugger it' before tasering 95yo Clare Nowland, court documents allege

image.altText: A young woman standing at a cash register looks at a woman sorting her groceries in a trolley.

items.synopsis: Woolworths is installing new AI security technology in response to a nationwide theft spike.

title.children: Theft increase prompts supermarket self-serve checkout security upgrades in WA

image.altText: David Warner completes a shot off his pad into the leg side

items.synopsis: Australia has not lost to England at Old Trafford in 44 years, but rain could complicate matters as visitors chase Ashes glory. Follow live.

title.children: Khawaja falls early after Australia is sent in on day one at Old Trafford

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Looked pretty good first up, but Khawaja waited until the final second. Yikes, that looks pretty out. Yes, that's very out, hitting the top of middle stump. Khawaja goes for a 19-ball 3.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: BIG APPEAL! KHAWAJA IS GIVEN OUT!

children.content: Looked pretty good first up, but Khawaja waited until the final second.
Yes, that's very out, hitting the top of middle stump.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: He calls tails and the coin lands on heads! Ben Stokes is pretty happy to bowl first. "We spoke about the weather quite a bit this week, but today's not too bad," Stokes says. "So we'll look to operate as we do and if the Test match gets deeper, we'll come up with some plans then. "If the game gets to that point where we have to push things on, then I think we will be very capable of doing that."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Australia loses toss, sent in to bat

children.content: He calls tails and the coin lands on heads!
Ben Stokes is pretty happy to bowl first.
"We spoke about the weather quite a bit this week, but today's not too bad," Stokes says.
"So we'll look to operate as we do and if the Test match gets deeper, we'll come up with some plans then.
"If the game gets to that point where we have to push things on, then I think we will be very capable of doing that."

image.altText: Athletes are seen before the start of the closing ceremony of the XXI Commonwealth Games on the Gold Coast.

items.synopsis: There are less than three years until the 2026 Commonwealth Games are to begin and few cities are capable of stepping in as host.

title.children: Victoria said no to the Commonwealth Games. Where else could they be held?

image.altText: A sign beside a road outside Hakea Prison and Melaleuca Women's Prison.

items.synopsis: A prisoner has admitted killing child sex offender Ashley Bropho while he was locked up at a WA jail earlier this year.

title.children: Perth inmate pleads 'very guilty' to murdering sex offender who lured 9yo from park

image.altText: Man holding an AFL ball in his hand.

items.synopsis: A coronial inquest hears AFL player Shane Tuck, who had chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE), displayed obsessive behaviours and heard voices before his death.

title.children: Former AFL player Shane Tuck's mental health was declining 14 years before his death, coronial inquest hears

image.altText: Army tank involved in Bruce Highway crash

items.synopsis: Six people are in hospital and motorists are being urged to avoid the Bruce Highway south of Rockhampton, after a seven-vehicle crash involving a US tank being transported by truck to a military training area.

title.children: Military police on scene of multi-vehicle crash involving truck carrying US tank

image.altText: A red and white sign advertising a home for rent is erected in front of a small brick fence in front of a weatherboard house.

items.synopsis: Analysis from CoreLogic suggests Australia's rental market may see a reprieve from high rental growth next year as the Reserve Bank reaches the end of its latest interest rate hiking cycle.

title.children: Rising rents likely to ease next year as RBA signals the end of rate hikes

image.altText: A man with beard wearing white t-shirt with graphic in a backyard

items.synopsis: A South Australian man, charged with criminal neglect after allegedly submerging an infant in a motel sink filled with hot water, is remanded in custody. Warning: This story contains content that some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Uncle denied bail after allegedly shoving two-year-old into scalding water

image.altText: Richard Marles with short grey hair wearing grey suit holds a plaque with Manasseh Sogavare in a black suit

items.synopsis: Richard Marles says the government is "very keen" to help Solomon Islands establish a defence force, with experts saying Canberra wants to stop any military cooperation between Beijing and Honiara.

title.children: Defence minister happy for Australia to support Solomon Islands defence force

image.altText: Thai police in dark uniforms stand in lines blocking a road, with large buildings nearby.

items.synopsis: Pita Limjaroenrat was the only candidate for leader of his party, which was the top finisher in May's general election, and was hoping to have another tilt but opponents say he was unqualified to run due to owning shares in a media company.

title.children: Thai parliament voids nomination of leading prime ministerial hopeful

image.altText: Peter wearing a blue check shirt, standing outside in the rural town of Norseman, with gumtrees and dirt.

items.synopsis: The Shire of Dundas spent $4,500 to ask a number of residents to delete Facebook comments that allegedly defamed its president and chief executive.

title.children: WA shire spends thousands on legal letters to residents over 'attack' comments on Facebook

image.altText: A man in a suit smile as he stands behind a micophone.

items.synopsis: All Indigenous students will be guaranteed a Commonwealth-supported place at the university of their choice, provided they meet entry criteria, as part of a set of reforms designed to make higher education more accessible for all Australians.

title.children: All Indigenous students guaranteed a funded university place as part of major education reforms

image.altText: An aerial view of several large buildings and some car parks, with one building highlighted in red.

items.synopsis: A disability supporter provider has been able to buy back a property it previously owned for the bargain price of $1, thanks to the long memory of an employee.

title.children: 'Amazing deal': Prime Tasmanian real estate bought for $1 after disability provider remembers sale clause

image.altText: A man sleeping in a messy bet with white bedding.

items.synopsis: A landmark study examining the sleep health of young Australian adults finds many are not getting enough sleep, putting their physical and mental wellbeing at risk.

title.children: Significant number of young Australians not getting enough sleep, study finds

image.altText: A woman with very long black fingernails holds her hands to her face

items.synopsis: Splendour in the Grass organisers say lessons have been learnt after last year's traffic chaos, but even Lizzo, Flume, and the Yeah Yeah Yeahs might not be able to raise the bar as hip pocket pressures hit ticket sales.

title.children: Ticket sales down by 30 per cent for this weekend's mega music festival Splendour

image.altText: A sign for Big W

items.synopsis: Yumi Stynes and Melissa Kang's sex education guide for teens is a topic of hot debate for its frankness. It also provides comprehensive, inclusive sex education that combats misinformation.

title.children: A teen sex ed book has been removed from Big W shelves to protect staff from abuse. This is what's actually inside

image.altText: A man dressed in an army uniform looks through gold binoculars next to a blue building.

items.synopsis: North Korea has stayed silent about the highly unusual entry of an American soldier across the heavily fortified border with South Korea. This is what we know so far and what has happened in the past.

title.children: What we know about the US soldier who 'willfully' crossed the border to North Korea

image.altText: An aerial image shows a volcanic island emitting white smoke surrounded by clear blue sea on a clear day.

items.synopsis: The criminal trial into the White Island disaster has heard from volcano monitor GNS Science about how it changed its risk assessment process after a "near miss".

title.children: White Island trial hears of 'near miss' as expert gives evidence on volcano risk

image.altText: Police and hazmat officials standing near a large canister on a beach.

items.synopsis: As authorities weigh up what to do with the large "foreign object", an expert says there is an increasing risk of space debris landing outside what's known as the "spacecraft cemetery".

title.children: As negotiations continue over WA's mystery rocket part, is this a sign of more space junk to come?

image.altText: Putin shaking hands with Cyril Ramaphosa who is smiling infront of colourful flags. Both are wearing black suits and red ties.

items.synopsis: Cyril Ramaphosa is rejecting calls from the country's opposition to arrest the Russian president if he attends an economic summit next month.

title.children: Arresting Putin would be a 'declaration of war', South Africa's president says

image.altText: A thin snake with grey on the top half and yellow scales on bottom half coiled on the dirt

items.synopsis: A new venomous species of snake is discovered after being mistaken as a different species for decades, researchers say.

title.children: New venomous species of desert snake discovered through genetic research

image.altText: A white background has six different cards on it with various images angled for perspective. An FC logo is present.

items.synopsis: The Yes and No cases for the Voice to Parliament, drafted by parliamentarians from each side of the debate. Who kept their facts straight?

title.children: We fact checked some of the claims made by the Yes and No campaigns. Here's what we found

image.altText: A sign reads Larni Barramal Yaluk Shrives Bridge with trees and shrubs behind

items.synopsis: A creek which was named after a derogatory term has regained its connection with Aboriginal language as part of a growing movement to reinstate traditional owner names.

title.children: Tears of joy as traditional owners celebrate end to creek's racist name

image.altText: Police officer looks away from camera at a press conference

items.synopsis: Acting Commissioner Michael Murphy says the demand placed on the Northern Territory Police Force from domestic violence reports is "incredible".

title.children: Domestic violence triple-0 calls 'overwhelming' NT Police

image.altText: A woman standing next to pink flowers gives a small smile to the camera.

items.synopsis: A drug support organisation in WA's South West has called for more funding for rehabilitation services, after the report testing wastewater found methylamphetamine use in regional parts of the state was the highest in the nation.

title.children: Calls for more funding for drug addiction support services as report reveals meth use in regional WA highest in Australia

image.altText: A woman in a winter coat and glasses.

items.synopsis: The lawyer for Raelene Polymiadis, who is accused of murdering her parents by injecting them with her own insulin, tells an Adelaide court her client's diabetes has been misdiagnosed by prison health authorities.

title.children: Woman accused of killing 94yo parents with insulin says prison authorities are mistreating her diabetes

image.altText: Aerials drone pics of Howard Springs Quarantine Facility.

items.synopsis: Nearly half of the reports received by police were domestic violence related, authorities say, after hundreds of residents from remote communities were evacuated from their flood-ravaged homes in early March.

title.children: Police investigated 145 incidents involving Howard Springs flood evacuees, data reveals

image.altText: An underwater photo of three seahorses, one is yellow, one is black and one is cream coloured.

items.synopsis: Marine scientists were able to find perfect conditions to raise the enchanting creatures, resulting in three pregnant males producing hundreds of babies.

title.children: Record release of 380 'amazing' baby seahorses into Sydney Harbour gives endangered species hope

image.altText: Two bearded men wearing dark blue scrubs smile for the camera in an operating theatre.

items.synopsis: Brenton Lovering and Mat Usher were shocked by the amount of plastic thrown out in health care. Their Tasmanian pilot program is aiming to change that.

title.children: Medical waste program aims to fix 'shocking' use of single-use plastics in health care

image.altText: A collage of one man and two women with a splattered watercolour effect in the background.

items.synopsis: Victoria and Western Australia were the first states to legalise voluntary assisted dying. As they prepare for mandatory reviews of their laws, it's renewed the debate about who should and shouldn't be allowed access.

title.children: 'Not dying quick enough': Christine's unknown prognosis means she can't access Voluntary Assisted Dying

image.altText: A man looks at stock prices through the window of the ASX in Sydney.

items.synopsis: The Australian share market rises to its highest level in a month, while ASIC cancels the financial services licence of cryptocurrency firm FTX's local subsidiary. Look back at how the day unfolded in our live blog.

title.children: ASX rises to four-week high, ASIC cancels crypto firm FTX's financial services licence — as it happened

image.altText: The back of a red Toyota Camry that is crushed to the point it's difficult to recognise it as a car, save for a license plate.

items.synopsis: Best friends Claire Sankey and Susi Kopysiewicz were killed when the car they were in veered off the Monaro Highway, crashing into two trees, in October last year.

title.children: Canberra teen who caused crash that killed two girls to be released from jail next October

image.altText: Donald Trump stands in front of a US flag

items.synopsis: For the third time this year, former US president Donald Trump has taken to social media to claim he's about to be charged in yet another criminal case. Here's what we know.

title.children: 'HORRIFYING NEWS': With a potential third arrest looming, Trump's legal situation just got worse
